jobs were scarce during the worldwide
depression in the 1930s in a small
Midwest town in the United States the
telegraph office announced they'd be
hiring a new Telegraph operator on the
day of the interview 60 hopeful men
packed the waiting room
to relieve their tension most of the job
applicants joked and chatted loudly with
one another one man however sat quietly
alone near the office door suddenly The
Quiet Man stood up and walked into the
office
a few minutes later the office manager
came to the door and announced thank you
all for coming today we have hired
someone for the job why was The Quiet
Man hired while the other men were
talking the office manager had Tapped
Out in Morse code if you hear this
message come in and accept the job only
one man was calm enough to hear the
message just as a quiet man was the only
one to hear the telegraph message the
devotee who deeply listens is the one
who hears Cosmic om

Mantra can be said to be the highest
form of philosophy because it provides
the concentrated form of language
necessary to embody the highest truths
beyond our physical reality David
Frawley remarks that Mantra is a deeper
level of speech that reflects the laws
of the universe what is called Dharma
that which upholds in Sanskrit Mantra is
the language of Dharma that enables us
to understand what Dharma is and how it
works that is why in Mantra yoga
different sounds correspond to the
Natural and spiritual forces through
which the universe operates starting
with om itself as the cosmic word Mantra
yoga provides us a means to understand
the sacred sound from the perspective of
a tradition that has taken it Beyond
mysticism into an organized and codified
fight spiritual signs Mantra yoga
includes a study of the qualities
inherent in sound itself through which
words and meanings are properly formed
it shows how sounds impact the nervous
system mind and heart and how we can
modify them to improve our lives
regardless of which background or
tradition you may personally follow the
insights provided in Mantra yoga can be
of enormous value to enable you to
manifest your destiny creatively
effectively and completely through
understanding the power of the word says
froly
the word Mantra is derived from two
Sanskrit words the first is Manas or
mind which provides the man syllable the
second syllable is drawn from the
Sanskrit word try meaning to protect all
to free from therefore the word Mantra
in its most literal sense means to free
from the mind the cognitive creative
mind Mantra is at its core a tool used
by the mind that eventually frees one
from the vagaries of the mind but the
journey from Mantra to Freedom is a
wondrous one the Mind expands deepens
and widens and eventually dips into the
essence of cosmic existence
on its Journey the Mind comes to
understand the essence of the vibration
of things a mantra a SRI aurobindo puts
it is a word of power and light that
comes from the overmind inspiration or
from a very high plane of intuition a
mantra is thus an inspired and intuitive
and rhythmic utterance a revealed seeing
it comes out of the realization of some
inmost truth of God and self
and man and nature Cosmos and life and
thing and thought and experience and
deed

offers mankind a universal Highway of
Awakening foreign
s occur in the ancient Hindu scriptures
called The Vedas while The Vedas are
voluminous and massive containing
elaborate rituals and instructions the
upanishads are short and condensed
philosophical texts explaining the
nature of reality the shortest and the
most profound of the upanishads is the
mandukiya upanishad it contains only 12
verses Dennis wait in his book AUM
Awakening to reality makes a scholarly
exposition of the Sacred Mantra in the
context of the mandukya upanishad the
upanishad conducts two essential
investigations the first into the nature
of the self and the second into the
Mantra om as a metaphor for the nature
of this reality the sound om is a fusion
of three Primal Psalms in the language a
u and M since all possible words contain
at least one of these elements the word
om contains all possible sounds so om is
the entire universe all that is and that
can be Mandu Kya upanishad states that
the self is Brahma and it has four
fundamental aspects modern Western
philosophy recognizes three states of
Consciousness waking dreaming and deep
sleep States
Advocate talks about a fourth state as
well and that makes all the difference
the first is the physical state of our
waking experience it is the first and
knowledge about the other states depends
on it and this state is represented by
the first sound a the second state is
the dream state where the dreamer
creates the world entirely out of the
stuff in his own mind hence it is a
Superior State to the waking State and
is represented by the sound you the
third state is a deep sleep state where
there is no subject object due division
it is not an unconscious state but
conscious of nothing non-dual reality
this state is represented by the sound M
there is another state Beyond these
three it is called turaya literally
means fourth but in fact it is not a
state after the third the upanishad says
that the Traya is transcendent Beyond
and other than the three changing states
and at the same time imminent intrinsic
to all the three states it is another
name for the all-pervading reality
itself Brahma hence the second Mantra of
the upanishad states I am Atma Brahma
this Atma is Brahma so in the sound om
the silence beyond the third Psalm
represents this Cosmic reality which is
the self and the universe at the same
time thus the sacred sound om captures
the core of the advaithi philosophy of
non-duality Dennis Waite tries to
explain the semantic 6 of the word om
this way language gives us the
capability to speak in general or
specific terms about the things that we
perceive if we continue to follow this
sort of series back to increasingly more
General words we will have to find a
catch-all world to include absolutely
everything that word is om
